meanings.definition: A single step taken when walking or running.
meanings.sent1: She took small paces around the room to calm her nerves.
meanings.sent2: He counted his paces as he walked along the path.
meanings.sent3: The cat mimicked her owner's paces, trying to walk like a human.
meanings.sent4: His heart raced, matching the quick paces of his feet.
meanings.sent5: The paces of the dancers were perfectly synchronized, creating a mesmerizing performance.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to 30 inches.
meanings.sent1: The fabric was measured in paces to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a paces stick to mark the dimensions.
meanings.sent3: The tailor chuckled as the customer requested a cloak of paces in length.
meanings.sent4: The bridge spanned a distance of many paces, connecting the two villages.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map showed the distance in paces, revealing the vastness of the kingdom.

meanings.definition: To walk at a steady and consistent speed.
meanings.sent1: She paces back and forth when she's anxious.
meanings.sent2: The soldier paces along the border, keeping watch.
meanings.sent3: The teacher paces the classroom, ensuring all students are engaged.
meanings.sent4: His mind paces ahead, already planning the next steps.
meanings.sent5: The horse paces gracefully, moving with elegance and poise.
